contentrichtext.text: '''Julien Josephson''' (October 24, 1881 – April 14, 1959) was an [[United States|American]] [[motion picture]] [[screenwriter]]. His career spanned between 1914 and 1943. He was a native of [[Roseburg, Oregon|Roseburg]], [[Oregon]]. Josephson was well known for his early [[silent film|silent movie]] adaptions of theatrical works such as [[Oscar Wilde]]'s ''[[Lady Windermere's Fan]]'' (1925) and [[Mary Roberts Rinehart]] and [[Avery Hopwood]]'s ''[[The Bat (1926 film)|The Bat]]'' (1926). He was nominated for an [[Academy Awards|Academy Award]] for his work on George Arliss' ''Disraeli'' (1929). He later wrote or co-wrote many popular films, including the [[Shirley Temple]] vehicles ''[[Heidi]]'' and ''[[Wee Willie Winkie (film)|Wee Willie Winkie]]'' (both 1937), ''Suez'' (1938) and ''[[Stanley and Livingstone]]'' (1939). ==Selected filmography== *''[[Head Over Heels (1922 film)|Head Over Heels]]'' (1922) *''[[Where the North Begins]]'' (1923) ==External links== *{{IMDb name|id=0430756|name=Julien Josephson}} *[http://movies.yahoo.com/shop?d=hc&id=1800075566&cf=biog&intl=us Yahoo!
